description: Implement specialized agent personas (Agent 2: Frontend, Agent 3: Backend, Agent 4: Testing) with strict domain boundaries. Update persona definitions with specialized expertise, enhance Lloyd's task assignment logic to match tasks to agent strengths, add specialization metadata to communication protocol, and update all documentation.
goal: Enable comprehensive agent specialization for improved task quality, optimized workflows, and effective parallel work across frontend, backend, and testing domains
requirements: Update agent-2.json with frontend specialization (UI, React, styling, component development)
Update agent-3.json with backend specialization (API, database, server logic, authentication)
Update agent-4.json with testing specialization (test coverage, QA, validation, debugging)
Enhance Lloyd persona with task-to-agent matching logic
Add agent specialization metadata to communication.json schema
Update persona system prompts with domain-specific workflows and best practices
Add specialization validation to assignment workflow
Document specialization system in CLAUDE.md and my-guide.md
out_of_scope: Agent self-assignment based on task analysis
Cross-training or skill sharing between agents
Performance metrics or agent rating systems
constraints: Must maintain backward compatibility with existing communication.json files
Specialized agents must refuse tasks outside their domain with clear error messages
Lloyd must validate agent specialization before assignment
Specialization must be evident in persona system prompts (not just metadata)
Must work with existing multi-agent coordination tools (assign_agent_task, verify_agent_completion)
Documentation must clearly explain when to use each specialist
